description: The wide mountain climber is a popular bodyweight exercise targeting the muscles of the core

title: Barbell roll-out
description: The barbell roll-out is an abdominal exercise that utilizes a barbell in the place of an ab roller. It is best performed with a barbell that has rotating collars and is considered more difficult than other ab roller variations. Many lifters may not be able to perform a single rep at first but once they can perform these for reps they'll be rewarded with a seriously strong core.

title: Seated bar twist
description: The seated bar twist is a core exercise meant to strengthen the obliques. It is often performed for high reps with relatively light weight such as an empty barbell a lightweight fixed-weight bar or even a PVC pipe. It can be performed during a workout at the end of a workout or outside of the gym to build core strength and resiliency.

title: Leg Raises
description: The Hanging Leg Raise is an advanced core exercise that targets the lower abdominal muscles hip flexors and overall core stability. It is performed while hanging from a pull-up bar requiring both grip strength and core control.

title: Dynamic pigeon stretch
description: The dynamic pigeon stretch is a lower-body stretch targeting the glutes

title: Leg Extension
description: The Leg Extension is an isolation exercise performed on a leg extension machine to specifically target the quadriceps (front thigh muscles). It is commonly used to strengthen the quads improve knee stability and enhance overall leg definition.

title: Russian Twist G
description: The Russian Twist is a core-strengthening exercise that primarily targets the obliques (side abs) while also engaging the rectus abdominis (six-pack muscles) and deep core stabilizers. It is commonly performed as a bodyweight movement but can be intensified using a medicine ball dumbbell or weighted plate.

title: Deadlift
description: A full-body strength movement focusing on the back glutes and hamstrings.

title: Mountain climber
description: The mountain climber is a popular bodyweight exercise targeting the muscles of the core

title: Wall mountain climber
description: The wall mountain climber is a challenging exercise targeting the shoulders and abdominals. It's most common in bodyweight circuit training because it targets a lot of muscles as well as the cardiovascular system all at once. It can be performed for time or reps.

title: FYR Bear Crawl Fire Feet
description: Bear crawl fire feet is a variation of the bear crawl that involves running in place while in a static bear crawl hold. It adds an extra coordination and full-body challenge to an already intense full-body movement that targets the cardiovascular system as well as a wide range of muscle groups. It can be done as a full-body warm-up

title: Kettlebell 3-point leg extension
description: The kettlebell 3-point leg extension is a dynamic core exercise performed around and over a kettlebell or other short stationary object. It is similar in some ways to a V-up or reverse crunch

title: Single-leg lying cross-over stretch
description: The single-leg lying cross-over stretch is a simple bodyweight stretch targeting the lower back

title: Bird dog-
description: The bird dog is a core exercise designed to help strengthen and stabilize the posterior chain. It involves lifting an opposite-side arm and leg while in a bent-leg tabletop position. It is most commonly performed as part of a dynamic warm-up

title: Single-leg lying cross-over stretch
description: The single-leg lying cross-over stretch is a simple bodyweight stretch targeting the lower back

title: Ab Crunch Machine
description: The machine crunch is a machine-based exercise targeting the abdominal muscles. It involves sitting upright in the machine and curling the torso down toward the chest against some pre-set level of resistance. On some machines

title: Standing torso twist stretch
description: The standing torso twist stretch is a stretching exercise targeting the lats and core

title: FYR Bear Crawl Shoulder Tap
description: The bear crawl shoulder tap is a variation of the bear crawl that involves touching the opposing shoulder while in a static bear crawl hold. It adds an extra coordination and core challenge to an already intense full-body movement that targets the cardiovascular system as well as a wide range of muscle groups. It can be done as a full-body warm-up

title: Dynamic pigeon stretch
description: The dynamic pigeon stretch is a lower-body stretch targeting the glutes

title: Leg Extension G
description: The Leg Extension is an isolation exercise performed on a leg extension machine to specifically target the quadriceps (front thigh muscles). It is commonly used to strengthen the quads improve knee stability and enhance overall leg definition.

title: BOSU cross-body crunch
description: The BOSU cross-body crunch is a dynamic abdominal exercise performed on a BOSU ball or other stability training device. It targets several of the muscles in the core

title: Leg Extension
description: The Leg Extension is an isolation exercise performed on a leg extension machine to specifically target the quadriceps (front thigh muscles). It is commonly used to strengthen the quads improve knee stability and enhance overall leg definition.

title: Crunches
description: The crunch is a popular core exercise targeting the rectus abdominis

title: Cable reverse crunch
description: The cable reverse crunch is performed on the ground facing away from a high pulley

title: Single-leg lying cross-over stretch
description: The single-leg lying cross-over stretch is a simple bodyweight stretch targeting the lower back

title: Bear crawl up-down
description: The bear crawl up-down is a variation of the bear crawl that involves lowering the forearms to the ground in an alternating rhythm while in a static bear crawl hold. It adds an extra coordination and upper-body challenge to an already intense full-body movement that targets the cardiovascular system as well as a wide range of muscle groups. It can be done as a full-body warm-up

title: 30 Hanging Oblique Crunch
description: The hanging oblique crunch an abdominal exercise that targets both the rectus abdominus or six-pack muscles

title: Standing torso twist stretch
description: The standing torso twist stretch is a stretching exercise targeting the lats and core

title: Two-way swing
description: The two-way kettlebell swing is an exercise that alternates a chest-height kettlebell swing (sometimes called a Russian or hardstyle swing) with an overhead kettlebell swing (sometimes called an American swing). Both swing variations work many of the same muscles

title: Plank
description: The Plank is a core-strengthening isometric exercise that engages the abdominal muscles lower back shoulders and glutes. It is a staple in fitness routines for improving core stability endurance and posture.

title: Dumbbell Crunch - Gethin Variation
description: The dumbbell crunch is a more difficult version of a highly popular abdominal movement. The simple addition of a weight makes the crunch far more difficult

title: Jump Lunge
description: The alternating lunge jump is an explosive bodyweight exercise that targets the lower-body muscles

title: FYR Bear Crawl Shoulder Tap
description: The bear crawl shoulder tap is a variation of the bear crawl that involves touching the opposing shoulder while in a static bear crawl hold. It adds an extra coordination and core challenge to an already intense full-body movement that targets the cardiovascular system as well as a wide range of muscle groups. It can be done as a full-body warm-up

title: Feet-elevated oblique crunch
description: The feet-elevated oblique crunch is a variation on the crunch exercise that targets the obliques as well as the rectus abdominis or six-pack muscles. Resting the feet on a bench takes some of the hip flexor activation out of the movement
